p: Hemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome (HFRS), a global infectious disease caused by hantaviruses (HV) in the Bunyaviridae family, is characterized by fever, hemorrhage, kidney damage and hypotension. All the currently known HV genotypes can cause HFRS, including Hantaan virus (HTNV), Seoul virus (SEOV), Puumala virus (PUUV) and Dobrava/Belgrade virus (DOBV/BGDV)[ 1, 2, 3]. In China, most cases are caused by two HV genotypes, HTNV and SEOV, which are mainly carried by the rodents Apodemus agrarius and Rattus norvegicus, respectively.
